Selection of cortical dynamics by the basal ganglia | Francesco Mannella

Selection of cortical dynamics by the basal ganglia

Reservoir computing models can describe the dynamics of the cortex. Cortical populations, possibly at the column level, can be seen as recurrent networks that utilize temporal dynamics.

The basal ganglia select different cortical dynamics within the cortex through a disinhibitory mechanism. This selection process is influenced by neuromodulation, particularly dopamine levels in the striatum.

Mannella F. and Baldassarre G. (2015), "Selection of cortical dynamics for motor behaviour by the basal ganglia", Biological Cybernetics. Vol. 109(6), pp. 575 – 595. Springer Verlag. [DOI] [URL]
